title: Sampler, 1703
medium:
Medium: wool embroidery on wool foundation
Technique: cross, montenegrin cross, eyelet, and double running stitches
inscribed:
"Look well to what you take in hand
 Tis better worth than house or land
 When lad is gone and money spent
 Leraning is most excellent"
provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description: Made by the maker of 1941-69-60. Here the name is spelt 'Alse'. Cross borders with ornament, alphabet and verse.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1703.
1703. Medium: wool embroidery on wool foundation
Technique: cross, montenegrin cross, eyelet, and double running stitches. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-61.
